dialogues.text: Nothing wrong with it. But I've sometimes wondered what else you have in your life besides work. Family? Boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: I did...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Morgan enthusiastically introduces Lucy around, everyone toasting her, hugging her, etc. She's trying not to show that she's a little annoyed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: And this, this is Larry Wuchich. 'The Wooch' -- I've known this maniac since third grade...

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Hello. They turn to the next guests. Julian and Mona. Mona eager to leave.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Oh hey. This is Julian. This guy's gonna help us find our Lake house.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Hi. Morgan sees that they're holding their coats.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: You're not leaving? Julian looks at them. Morgan's arm around Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: No. We'll stay. Mona glares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian is looking for a bathroom. He passes a bedroom door, ajar. INSIDE, Morgan is kissing Lucy. Julian steps back quickly. He overhears:

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Were you surprised?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I was. When are they going to leave?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: What's the matter? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Nothing. Long train ride. I don't know. I guess I thought we were going to be alone tonight.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: These are my friends, Lu. They’re going to be our friends. I want you to get to know them. We’re going to be making a life here.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: I know. I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy and Anna at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: ON LUCY
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: We moved together after I finished med school. He rented this great house. Gorgeous place, up north, right on the Lake. His hometown. I did my internship. We were going to live there forever. That was the plan.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: It was his plan.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Ah.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: No. That's not fair. I thought I wanted it too. I don’t know. Anyway, I ended it.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: So who do you write to?  67.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Lucy says

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: I couldn’t help noticing. Every time you get a break at the hospital you're writing, or reading a letter. nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: Sorry. It's none of my business.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: No. It's okay. There is somebody. (slowly) It's kind of a... long distance relationship.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: How long?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Long.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: How'd you meet?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: We haven't.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: We just write letters.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: You're kidding.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: You mean, like a pen pal?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: You got it. Anna laughs, but Lucy looks morose. She drains her drink. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Story of my life. (beat) Keep everything at a nice, safe distance. Everyone... (sighs) The guy who was right in front of me, who wanted to marry me -- I push him away, I run. Meanwhile, the one man I can never even meet -- him, I want to give my whole heart to. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: ANNA
dialogues.text: So you've really never spoken face-to-face?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Never. (stops, suddenly realizing) No. Wait. Once...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy comes out of the party. The look of someone badly in need of a break. She sits. Beat. Then she realizes that she's not alone. Julian is out here too, alone. She nods to him. He nods back, not sure what to say, if he should say anything. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Happy birthday.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: If one more person says that to me tonight I'll kill them.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: (backing off) Right. Beat. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Sorry. I know it's no big deal. Just another year. I guess I'm not really in a party mood.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Me either.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: So what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: I was... hoping to meet somebody.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Someone Morgan told me about.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Ah. A fix up.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Kind of.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: He's always thinking ahead, our Morgan. (beat) So what are you waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: I'm trying to work up my nerve. She smiles, nods. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: So. You're going to get us a place on the Lake, huh?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Yes. I am. She's a little taken aback by the confidence of his response.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Are you a real estate agent?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: No. But I have a Lake House. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: (puzzled) Oh.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: And you're going to rent it after I move out. (beat) I mean, you could. If you want to.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: When are you moving out?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: I'm... not sure. I guess after you finish med school? She stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Morgan said you were in medical school... He trails off. Uncomfortable pause. Lucy is confused, and Julian feels he bas lost his grip on the conversation, if he ever had one.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: What makes you think we'd like it?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: You'll like it.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Can you swim?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Sure, I took lessons as a kid.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: No, I mean, can you swim from the house?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Oh. He laughs. She laughs too.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Uh no. You can't. That's one drawback. There's no way down to the water. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: That's too bad.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: (nods) Yeah. As he talks, he moves over and sits down next to her.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: (growing more animated) I've actually thought -- well, you'd have to see it, but I've always had this idea you could change it. Nothing major. But a few new elements would really transform it. A deck out back. And some stairs.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Stairs going down to the water?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Just like a gentle slope, curving down... So you could step out the back door and slip into the Lake whenever you felt like it. Or if you just wanted to sit out there...

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: That sounds nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy looks back at the house. Party still going strong. She sighs.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: It's pretty late. Hadn't you better get back in there? If you're going to find your dream girl tonight?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah... He hesitates, not sure what to do. He stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Lucy...  72.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: (quickly) Have you read Persuasion by Jane Austen? Lucy looks startled.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: It's my favorite book. (beat) Why?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: I have a friend who likes it.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Your friend bas good taste.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Yes. She does. (beat) I've been meaning to read it.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: You should.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: I will. He sits down next to her.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: What's it about?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: It's about... waiting. (beat) These two people meet. They almost fall in love, but the timing isn't right, and they have to part. Then, years later, they meet again. They get another chance. But they don't know if too much time has passed, if they've waited too long, if it's too late for things to work out.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Sounds sad. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: It's not. Not in the end. They're sitting quite close. She looks at him. She suddenly inclines her head toward his and their lips meet. A long, lingering kiss. After a moment she breaks off.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: I don't know why I did that.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: I'll try to explain... He is leaning into her again when... The door behind them OPENS and Morgan and Mona come out. Julian and Lucy quickly separate but Morgan and Mona can see they've interrupted something. Very uncomfortable moment.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Oh, Morgan, hey. Uh, Julian was just telling me about his house. It sounds really great.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: (stony) Great.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: (to Julian) We're, uh, definitely interested.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Good. I'll be in touch. (he stares at her. then, almost to himself) I promise.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: Julian. It's late. Julian reluctantly gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy rides home from the Cove in a cab.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: My God. That was you. I remember you. Why didn't you tell me who you were?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian drives home through the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Come on. You would have thought I was insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the scene continues, TIME PASSES for both of them (NOTE: we might see time lapse footage, etc.), although we experience this exchange as a single conversation.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: (frustrated) But I liked you. That was our chance. You should have told me.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: What about your boyfriend?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: What about your girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: She's not my girlfriend!

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Well, he's not my boyfriend!

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: He was then! I mean, he is now.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Your now, not mine! And maybe ‘now' would be different if you had said something then. Maybe now would have come sooner, or maybe now it would be our now, not just my now, you know?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: No! I don’t! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: IN HER APARTMENT, Lucy reads this, groans in frustration, and tosses the letter across the room. IN THE LAKE HOUSE, Julian, equally frustrated, tosses his pencil away. IN BOTH CONTINUITIES JACK dodges the objects, and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry is on a bench on the plaza, reading before class. Vanessa arrives, carrying a portfolio. She sits down on the other end of the bench. She looks at Henry.

dialogues.speaker: VANESSA
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (barely noting her) Hey. He keeps reading. Beat. She jiggles the portfolio up and down on her lap nervously. Henry glances over and she stops.

dialogues.speaker: VANESSA
dialogues.text: Sorry. (clutching the portfolio) I'm presenting today,

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: You nervous?

dialogues.speaker: VANESSA
dialogues.text: A little, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: There's no reason for you to be. She brightens.

dialogues.speaker: VANESSA
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Nah. Whatever you did, I'm sure he'll shoot it down. Her face falls. She gets up quickly and walks away. Henry is not aware that he's upset he (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He reads a bit more, then checks his watch and gets up to go in. He sees something and stops.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Oh no. But he suddenly runs across the plaza. Vanessa is kneeling over a MAN who has collapse near the entrance to the school. It is their professor, Burnham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian comes home. Jack waiting for him. He pours food for the dog, then notices his answering machine is blinking. He plays the message.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (on machine) Julian. Listen. It's your Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian rushes into the hospital. He goes to the admissions desk.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: I'm looking for my father, Julian Burnham. He was admitted today.

dialogues.speaker: DOCTOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mr. Burnham? Julian turns. A doctor is approaching him. Anna Klyczynski -- here, of course, two years younger than we've seen her before.

dialogues.speaker: KLYCZYNSKI
dialogues.text: I'm Anna Klyczynski. I'm the attending for your father.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: What happened? Is he okay?

dialogues.speaker: KLYCZYNSKI
dialogues.text: He's okay. Walk with me. He's had a heart attack. Fortunately relatively minor, and his students got him here quickly. We're monitoring him. We'll probably want to keep him for a day or two.  77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry is waiting outside Burnham's room as Julian walks up. He stands. Julian and Henry hug.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Hank. My God. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Are you kidding? I'm just sorry I had to leave it on your machine. You all right?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Julian breaks off, readies himself to go in. He indicates the closed door.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Is he sleeping?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: No. Julian starts to go in.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Julian. I wouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: He's busy.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Busy? Doing what?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Evaluating a student project. Julian looks disbelieving. He starts to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Can't let a little coronary throw off your whole class schedule. Julian shakes his head. The door opens. Vanessa comes out, carrying her portfolio. She walks up to Henry. She looks him in the eye. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VANESSA
dialogues.text: He loved it. She turns on her heels and walks away. Henry watches her go, taken aback. Julian lets himself into the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham is propped up in bed, hooked up to monitoring machines, reading. He has a lot of work with him -- professional journals and magazines, papers, etc. Julian walks into the room quietly, almost tentatively. Burnham doesn't hear him at first. When he does finally look over, he lowers his book but doesn't put it down.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian sits at a table, writing.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: I know I haven't written for a while. But I need to... I wanted to tell you about my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy reads the letter.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: He's famous. You know his work -- he built the Lake House. He sold it years ago, after my mother died. I guess he was trying to slam the door on that chapter of his life. Of course it was my life too. I got it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian stares at the page. Then writes another line.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: That's just one of the reasons we don't get along.  79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian brings Burnham a cup of coffee. Burnham is still up and working.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: I m not supposed to do this. I had to sneak it past three nurses.

dialogues.speaker: BURNHAM
dialogues.text: It's not decaf, is it?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: No. Burnham takes it, sips, goes back to his reading. Awkward beat. Julian sits. Eventually Burnham glances over.

dialogues.speaker: BURNHAM
dialogues.text: I don't need you.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: I'm gonna stay until your test results come in.

dialogues.speaker: BURNHAM
dialogues.text: That's not until morning.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: There's no point driving all the way back up tonight. Burnham shrugs, goes back to his reading. The silence is deafening. Julian fidgets. After a moment he picks up one of the architecture magazines.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Do you mind if I...

dialogues.speaker: BURNHAM
dialogues.text: Help yourself. Julian sits down, glum, and flips through it.

dialogues.speaker: BURNHAM
dialogues.text: If that kind of thing still interests you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy continues reading. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I've made my share of small, stupid mistakes in my life. But I've made one huge, epic, massively stupid ultra-mistake. And that was going to architecture school to study under the great Louis Burnham.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham is now asleep. Julian watches him breathing in the dimly-lit room, the monitoring machines blinking silently.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Everybody said I had his talent. zry te learn from the old man. Fo ow in his footsteps -- maybe all the anger and mistrust would just... melt away. Julian gently takes the empty coffee cup out of his father's hand. He picks up the papers strewn on the bed and stacks them neatly on the bedside table.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Right. Every class becomes a war zone. Every dispute inflamed by years of bitter feeling. Julian sits, trying to find a comfortable position to sleep in the hospital room chair. It's impossible. He stares at the figure sleeping in the bed.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Somebody had to surrender. So I did. I quit. (beat) And that is why, at the same age when my father was embarking upon a legendary career, I am throwing up condos and living in the old man's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian looks strung-out after his night in the chair. Burnham examines his breakfast tray, annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: BURNHAM
dialogues.text: No coffee. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: You just had a heart attack. Don't you think you can do without it?

dialogues.speaker: BURNHAM
dialogues.text: Without it, I'll have a fucking stroke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian brings the coffee to his father's room, annoyed. Before he can go in Klyczynski comes out, carrying a patient file. Julian is

dialogues.speaker: KLYCZYNSKI
dialogues.text: There you are. Thought I'd missed you. We were just going over his results.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: (disbelief) I was coming right back. He didn't ask you to wait?

dialogues.speaker: KLYCZYNSKI
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Jesus. really surprised and hurt by this. Klyczynski sits him down.

dialogues.speaker: KLYCZYNSKI
dialogues.text: I'll tell you everything I told your Dad. He's going to be fine, as long as we do some intervention.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Intervention?

dialogues.speaker: KLYCZYNSKI
dialogues.text: An angioplasty. It's quite routine, and it should prevent a repeat of the coronary episode. He's agreed to schedule for tomorrow, get it done quickly.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Whatever he wants. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Julian gets up and starts off.

dialogues.speaker: KLYCZYNSKI
dialogues.text: You're welcome to go in if you'd like.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: I've got to get back to work.

dialogues.speaker: KLYCZYNSKI
dialogues.text: Don't you want to speak with him before the surgery? Julian hands her the cup of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Just give him this. It's all he wanted from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian drives back up North, grim. He arrives at the Lake House.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN, (V. 0.)
dialogues.text: I don't know what I was expecting. I guess part of me thought, well, Dad's in a bed in Cook County Hospital, he's about to have serious surgery, it might go a little bit deeper than 'Is this decaf? (beat) But of course that's not how things work. When I quit school I rejected everything he stood for. That's how he saw it. So buying this house must have seemed like a sick joke. Maybe he was right. I don't know and it's too late to change things now. One thing's for sure: if I really was hoping for a tearful little bedside reunion. I'm as stupid as he thinks I am. (beat) Well. I seem to have poured my little heart out here. Sorry. Thanks for reading.  83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy reads.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I find myself wanting to tell you things I've never told anyone. Things I didn't know myself until I wrote them down to send to you. Maybe that's the strangest part of all of this. (beat) Love, Julian. Lucy lingers on this letter, on the last word, "LOVE." Jack trots up and jumps into her lap. She pets him, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jack trots over to Julian's bed. He jumps up on it. Julian is lying awake, unable to sleep but it's too early to get up. He pets the dog. He has an impulse to pick up the telephone. He resists it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy comes into the hospital a bit early for her shift. She goes to an elevator and gets in. She punches the button for a sub-sub-basement. As she rides down she takes out Julian's letter and studies it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnham is on a gurney being wheeled down the corridor toward surgery by an ORDERLY. He suddenly tries to sit up. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BURNHAM
dialogues.text: Stop.

dialogues.speaker: ORDERLY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BURNHAM
dialogues.text: I've decided... Before I go in I want to make a call, please.

dialogues.speaker: ORDERLY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, sir, I got to get you straight into the O.R. You'll have to do it after. Burnham reluctantly nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy searches through endless shelves of old patient records. She eventually locates a file labeled "LOUIS BURNHAM.” She spreads it open and begins paging through it. Past test results, etc. She turns a page and stops. A DEATH CERTIFICATE. She looks at it, disturbed. It is signed by Anna Klyczynski. The date given is two years earlier. Place of death: Cook County Hospital. Cause: coronary failure during surgery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy runs up to Madhvi Patel, urgent.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Madhvi. I've got an emergency. Take my shift.

dialogues.speaker: PATEL
dialogues.text: Now?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: I've covered for you. Please. Madhvi nods. Lucy runs out.  85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy drives toward the Lake House, very worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian gathers his things for work and walks across the jetty toward his truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy stops in front of the mailbox and jumps out. She shoves a note in and yanks up the red flag. She stares at it, breathless.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian driving away. He hasn't noticed that the mailbox flag is up. His truck recedes into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy opens the box quickly. Her letter is stlll inside. She bangs on the mailbox, tears of frustration in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Goddamn it. The flag stays up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian working on a rooftop. His CELL PHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: KLYCZYNSKI, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (on phone) Mr. Burnham? this is Doctor Klyczynski at Cook County.  86.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: KLYCZYNSKI, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (beat) I'm afraid I have some difficult news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian runs to his truck and takes off. Mona sees him dashing away. She calls after him. But he doesn't stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian arrives home. He is pale, stunned. He sees the flag on the mailbox. He retrieves Lucy's note, opens it and glances briefly at it before letting his arm drop to his side. The note drops, fluttering away, to land in the water beneath the Jetty.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE NOTE
dialogues.text: The ink is smearing in the water but we can see the words

dialogues.speaker: "GO BACK TO THE HOSPITAL NOW
dialogues.text: YOUR FATHER...”

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian outside a chapel, in a dark suit, nodding at MOURNERS as they file in for his father's memorial service.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Julian. I am terribly sorry about your father. (beat) I knew I had to at least try to warn you. I thought I could get there in time. I hoped we could change what happened. (beat) I was wrong. I guess these things can't be changed. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: If they could, then the file wouldn't have said what it said, so I never would have tried to warn you... and then we'd be right back where we are anyway. It just goes in circles and I don't pretend to understand it. All I know is the shock feels fresh to me, even though it happened two years ago, so I can't imagine what it's like for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian listens, blank-faced, to the pastor. MOVING OVER the faces of the attendees, Henry and other students among them. FIND Anna Klyczynski sitting in the back. She looks like she hasn't slept.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: These things just... happen sometimes. I know. Last February -- I remember it was Valentine's Day, but it was really warm -- I was at Buckingham Fountain. And something happened. I won't bore you with the details now, but it was rough. Not like what you're going through, but it bothered me a lot. And a friend gave me some good advice. She said to go somewhere that made me feel most like my true self.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The funeral reception is being held at the school. Examples of Burnham's work on display around the room. Julian shakes hands with other MOURNERS.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: So I did. I drove to the Lake House. And that was the day I got your first letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the reception, Henry and a few other STUDENTS help fold chairs, clean up.  88. CONTINUED ;

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It's a place we both love, and it's a place your father built, so I hope you can find some solace there. FIND Julian sitting alone before a large photo of the Lake House, looking lost.

dialogues.speaker: THE SAME PHOTO
dialogues.text: on the page of a book held by Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: And I hope that whatever separated you will come to seem less important, and perhaps, in time, disappear. She is in the architecture section of the Art Institute bookshop. She takes the book to the front to pay for it.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Yours, Lucy. (beat) P.S. About the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian at the mailbox. He holds the book that Lucy has sent to him, along with the letter we've been hearing.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: It won't be published for a year or two, so don't show it to anybody. But I thought you should see it. Julian opens to the first page. The title is LOIUS BURNHAM - LIFE WORKS. The publication date is 2004. Then he notices that Lucy has marked one page. Julian turns to it. It’s the photo of Julian at age 7 with his parents on the jetty of the Lake House. Julian stands on the jetty, staring at the photo.  89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits, still looking at the same page. Then turns from the photo and flips through the rest of the book. Photos, blueprints, sketches -- a lifetime of complex, beautiful work.

dialogues.speaker: ON JULIAN
dialogues.text: admiration in his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian carefully selects a large sketch pad and some charcoal pencils from among the art supplies. He carries them to the front and gives them to the CLERK.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: I'd like these, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian perches on the back ledge in the fading daylight, his feet dangling. The sketch pad is on his lap but be hasn't drawn anything. He looks down at the water, far below. He makes a decision and begins to write.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy on her bed, holding the same piece of sketching paper. She stares at it.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PAGE
dialogues.text: Julian has written in charcoal "I WANT TO MEET YOU. FOR

dialogues.speaker: INT. LUCY'S APARTMENT/INT. LAKE HOUSE
dialogues.text: Julian and Lucy write and pace, anxious and eager -- another exchange of letters that plays as a CONTINUOUS CONVERSATION.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Pick a place. I'll be there. I promise. Tomorrow, what do you say?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Julian. It’s not tomorrow for you. You’ll have to wait two years.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: I don't care. I'll wait. Go to the restaurant tomorrow and I'll be there. I'll be two years older but I'll be there.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: What will you do all that time?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Think of you. (beat) And work out every day, get in shape, pray I don't lose my hair... Lucy smiles. Beat. She takes giddy.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: I've never been so sure of anything in my life. I've lost so much time already. I don't want to lose any more with you. a deep breath. She suddenly feels almost

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: See you 1n two years, then.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: See you tomorrow night. (beat) Where would you like to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian in the restaurant talking to the Restaurant Hostess (here two years younger than we've seen her before). She leafs through the reservation book.

dialogues.speaker: HOSTESS
dialogues.text: Well, I'm sorry, but we just received our fourth star and I'm afraid a reservation at this time will be extremely difficult. When were you hoping to dine with us?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Two years from tomorrow. September 15, 2004. The Hostess blinks. She closes the book.

dialogues.speaker: HOSTESS
dialogues.text: We should be able to accommodate you, sir. DISSOLVE TO;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy getting ready to leave for work. She checks an elegant, rather sexy new DRESS that she has hanging in the closet, ready for tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy finishing rounds. She returns a stack of files to the nurses' station and starts for the locker room, eager to leave. Klyczynski comes running up.

dialogues.speaker: KLYCZYNSKI
dialogues.text: Lucy. We never got daily bloods from the floor.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: What? The interns were supposed to...

dialogues.speaker: KLYCZTI/SKI
dialogues.text: The interns screwed up. Listen, if we each take half we can get it done pretty fast... Lucy nods, rushes off.  92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy waits on the platform for the train home, late, impatient.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Come on, shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She enters in a hurry, runs to the bedroom throwing off her clothes. Jack is watching her. She notices him. She takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: He's waited two years. What's another half-hour. Right? She continues her preparations, but at a calmer pace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy exits her building. She looks spectacularly elegant and beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy approaches the restaurant. She stops before she goes in. She's ready: excited but calm, confident. She opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she checks her coat she scans the room. There aren't many tables. Before she can locate Julian the Hostess comes up to her.

dialogues.speaker: HOSTESS
dialogues.text: May I help you?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Yes. I have a reservation. Forster. Or Burnham, I'm not sure which name it's under. The Hostess examines her book.

dialogues.speaker: HOSTESS
dialogues.text: Oh! Yes! You're the... (stopping herself) Follow me.  93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy is shown to a table for two. It's empty. She is a little surprised.

dialogues.speaker: HOSTESS
dialogues.text: I hope you'll forgive me, but I can't help asking...

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: HOSTESS
dialogues.text: (eager) This reservation is sort of... legendary. It's been here longer than-most of the staff. There’s always been intense speculation about who made it, and why, and if you'd actually show up. Some of the crew even have bets going... Lucy looks around. WAITERS all over the room are sneaking glances at her. CHEFS and BUSBOYS peering out from behind the kitchen door. Lucy suddenly feels very self-conscious.

dialogues.speaker: HOSTESS
dialogues.text: (quickly) I'm sorry. I shouldn't have -- I'll send the waiter for your drink order right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WAITER pours Lucy a glass of champagne.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: Complimentary.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: WAITER
dialogues.text: (can't help himself) Good luck. He darts away. She sips the champagne, nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her glass is empty. She is still waiting, alone at the table. The Waiter comes over to refill her glass, but Lucy stops him.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She is aware that the restaurant staff is watching her, whispering to one another. The Hostess shoos them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hours have passed. OTHER DINERS are lingering over dessert, coffee, chatting intimately across the candlelit tables. Lucy still is alone. After a long moment she pushes her chair back and gets up. Everyone is watching her, grave. She makes her way to the front, expressionless. She collects her coat, not speaking to anyone. She exits. The Hostess watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy walks home, alone. Her stoic facade begins to crumble. Tears in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: You weren't there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A windy, grey day on the lake. Julian at the mailbox, reading the words "YOU WEREN'T THERE." He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: (out loud) I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian drives along the Lake.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I don't get it. Something must have happened. Look I've got two years. I'll try to fix it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy gets up. She slept in her dress.  95.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Her face is puffy from crying. She goes to the bathroom and scrubs her face clean. She puts on everyday clothes. She hangs up her dress in the closet and shuts the closet door.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: No, Julian... You don’t understand. It’s too late. It already happened. (beat) I’m not upset. Well, I was at first. But now I just feel stupid -- for forgetting how much a person's life can change in two years. And for expecting yours not to change. For expecting you to wait -- to run in place, to put your life on hold, for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian throws stones into the Lake, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: But I can do it. I can wait for you. I know I can. I wouldn't just forget...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy changes into her scrubs.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Maybe you did. Maybe wherever you are 'now,' you're busy, and happy, and living so fully in the present that the dinner date you made two years ago just... slipped your mind. The way we forget impossible fantasies when we outgrow them, when we get on with our real lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian broods over this letter. Mona is at her desk, looking at him with longing. She looks away when he glances over.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Are you saying I should get on with my real life?  96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy wheels a PATIENT -- a pretty WOMAN, 30s, being discharged. She thanks Lucy, effusive, then turns to greet her approaching HUSBAND and DAUGHTER. Lucy watches as her patient embraces her joyful family, hugging them close.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: I'm saying... I think we both should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian reads this last line, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian dashes off an obviously emotional reply. The final words are "PLEASE WRITE BACK."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian puts his letter in the mailbox and raises the flag. It stays up. He opens it; his letter is still inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WEEKS PASSING AS Julian writes and posts letter after letter. Eventually there is a STACK of his letters in the box. They keep piling up, and they are never answered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is now winter, a snowy night in Chicago. Patel, Costello, Klyczynski and some other DOCTORS are ina booth talking, laughing, winding down after work. LUCY is with them.

dialogues.speaker: INT. LUCY'S APARTMENT NIGHT
dialogues.text: Lucy comes home to find a message waiting on her Answering machine.  97.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She plays it.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: (on machine) Hey, Lu. It's Morgan. I'm in Chicago. I had to come down for a meeting. Lucy starts to press the DELETE button.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (V .0.)
dialogues.text: (on machine) A real one this time. I swear. She hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (V .0.)
dialogues.text: (on machine) Call me. Only if you feel like it.

dialogues.speaker: INT. PIZZA PLACE
dialogues.text: Lucy and Morgan eat in the pizza place they wound up in before. They seem more or less at each with each other.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: I didn't think you'd come out.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Don't take it personally.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: You just couldn’t say no to the free meal.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Exactly. He laughs.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: So. How'd your 'meeting' go?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: I told you. I didn't make it up, it really happened.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Prove it.  98.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: They offered me a job.

dialogues.speaker: ON LUCY
dialogues.text: surprised.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Big telecom company. I’m gonna be in-house counsel. (smiles) Call them if you don't believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: When will you move?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Right away. (off her look) I took the job because I wanted the job. It happened to be in Chicago. It's no ambush, Lu. She nods.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: And the man swore he'd never leave his hometown.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: (shrugs) People change. They arrive at her building.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Well, it's great news. Congratulations, Morgan. I'm really happy for you.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Thanks. Thanks for coming out.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Anytime. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She leans in and kisses him goodnight, briefly. Morgan surprised and pleased. She looks at him. It's comfortable, familiar. A tree behind Morgan sways in the night air. It's the tree Julian planted. Lucy glances at it, then closes her eyes and draws Morgan to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mailbox is covered with snow. It’s so cold that the Lake has frozen near the shore. Julian, walking by, checks inside the mailbox, a reflex. It's empty. He SLAMS it shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mona Jaffee opens her front door. Julian standing there. She looks at him, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: What's the matter? Is there a problem at the site?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: No, no problem.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: So what are you doing here? He steps forward. He kisses her. She returns it, eager. She pulls him inside.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: What took you so damn long? She closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian walks Jack on a cold morning near the Lake. Julian's distracted, out of it, and doesn't notice as Jack trots away, toward the frozen lake. Julian finally looks around for the dog.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Hey! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jack starts running. Julian chases him. Jack dashes onto the lake, chasing birds across the ice. Julian goes out after him.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Jack! But Jack is far away and getting farther, making for some distant trees. Julian tries to follow. He slips on the ice. By the time he gets to his feet Jack is nowhere to be seen. Julian wheels around, upset. The dog is really gone. Julian is about to call him again when he suddenly stops. A realization dawns on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mona's red cowboy BOOTS CRUNCH through the SNOW as she heads for the trailer. As she walks in, Julian is filling a cardboard box, clearing out his desk. She stares at him. After a moment:

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: We're on schedule. We're ahead even. The crew know the job backwards. It would take a major earthquake for you not to finish on time and you're not going to have a major earthquake.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: How do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: I know. (beat) I've got to go. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: Is it the job? Or me?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Neither. I'm sorry, Mona. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: I don't get it. Why now?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: It's just time.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: You sound so sure. Julian nods.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: Well, shit, Julian. She sits down, unhappy. Beat. She suddenly grabs her boots and yanks them off.

dialogues.speaker: MONA
dialogues.text: These were so fucking uncomfortable. She mock-throws them at him. He dodges, smiles. She can't help smiling back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian methodically and determinedly packs up the house. He tapes together cardboard boxes and throws his possessions in. He bags garbage and sweeps and mops. In the course of his work he finds a stack of Lucy's letters. He looks at them for a moment, then bundles them up and buries them deep in a cardboard box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He carries the box into the attic and seals it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan in his storefront law office. Outside, Julian pulls up in his truck. The flatbed is piled with his possessions. Morgan comes out. He recognizes Julian from the party, and doesn't look happy to see him.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Still want to rent a Lake House? Julian tosses him a set of keys. Morgan looks stony. He throws them back. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: It's what Lucy wants.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: How the hell do you know?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Trust me. Julian hands him the keys. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan watches Julian drive away. He's taken the house. He pockets the keys and turns to go back inside. Something catches his eye.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DISTANCE
dialogues.text: A DOG is ambling slowly down the street, looking cold and lost and forlorn. It's Jack. ON Morgan.

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC OVER
dialogues.text: As TIME PASSES in BOTH CONTINUITIES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winter. Julian unloads his truck and moves in with Henry in Henry's ramshackle Chicago apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan moving into Lucy's small apartment, unpacking. Lucy clears space in her closet for his clothes. He goes to her and they kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry graduates from school. Julian 1s there to congratulate him. Vanessa is also graduating. Henry moves to congratulate her. They look at each other.  103. INT. ARCHITECTURE CLASSROOM (JULIAN’S CONTINUITY) Autumn. ARCHITECTURE STUDENTS taking notes. FIND Julian among them; he is back at school. He takes notes as a PROFESSOR lectures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy goes through her closet, putting away summer clothes, taking out sweaters. She comes across the dress she wore to meet Julian. She stares at it, then shoves it to the back of her closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winter. Lucy at an upscale NEW YEAR'S EVE party. Morgan joking with a group of annoying lawyers. Lucy looks bored. It's midnight. Everyone celebrates. Morgan turns to Lucy and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian at a New Year's party. Scruffy student crowd. At midnight, everyone embraces. FIND Henry and Vanessa kissing, in love. Julian, alone, looks out the window as fireworks go off in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winter. Julian walking down the street toward the architecture school, a portfolio under his arm. It's cold. He pulls his scarf tighter around his neck. It's the scarf Lucy gave him. He passes a Chicago row house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same house. It now has a "FOR SALE" sign in front. Morgan walks up the steps. END MONTAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan goes inside. The house is empty. It's a solid old place but badly in need of renovation. Lucy is already here. They walk through the echoing rooms. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: This is what I gave up lunch for?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: I know it needs work.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: It needs a hell of a lot of work.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: I found an architect who specializes in renovations. I made an appointment for tomorrow. He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Ambush. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: We can't stay in my apartment. It's been almost a year. I want to keep moving forward. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian comes home. Henry, wearing a coat and tie, is slumped on the couch. He looks discouraged. Vanessa consoling him.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: How'd it go today?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: No one's hiring. Or at least no one's hiring me.

dialogues.speaker: VANESSA
dialogues.text: Give it some time.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I have. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Hey. As soon as I graduate we start the firm. Remember? Visionary Vanguards? Henry nods, dejected. INT. JULIAN’S ROOM - NIGHT Very late. Julian is bent over his drawing board, working intently. Henry passes the open doorway. He looks in.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: All-nighter? Julian looks up, self-conscious.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Oh. No. This is just... my own thing. Henry moves to look at Julian's work. Julian tries to hide it.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Let me see.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: It's nothing.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Come on. Julian relents.

dialogues.speaker: ON HIS SKETCH
dialogues.text: It is THE LAKE HOUSE -- but re-imagined. There's a deck running along the back, and stairs curving down to the water --t he stairs Julian described to Lucy. There are trees planted along the jetty, and lights glowing in the trees. The house is just as striking as before, but much less stark, much warmer, romantic.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (beat) I like it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: I didn't think you'd approve.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: The old house is a place you go to be alone. This one, you bring somebody to. Julian nods. Henry looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (quietly) Who is she?

dialogues.speaker: ON JULIAN
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Lucy. Her name was Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: When you were living there? Julian nods.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I knew it. What happened?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: I lost her.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: It's hard to explain. Mostly it was... bad timing.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: You miss her? Julian can only nod. Beat. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Get her back.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: It's too late. Or too early...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Nothing. (shakes his head) I don't even know where she is. Even if I did, I can’t just walk up to her and say, 'Hey, here I am, let's pick up where we left off.’

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: What have you got to lose?

dialogues.speaker: ON JULIAN
dialogues.text: doubtful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan buried under piles of work. Lucy clicking through channels on the TV. She comes across a station showing the Grant/Bergman kiss from Notorious. She holds on it.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Hey, could you turn that down a little, babe? Lucy clicks OFF the TV, annoyed, and goes into the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she walks in, the FLOORBOARD SQUEAKS. She stops, then tests it with her toe. It SQUEAKS again. She bends down to examine it and finds that it lifts up quite easily. Lucy pulls the floorboard back. To her surprise, there's a space underneath. She reaches down into it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She pulls out a package wrapped tight in dusty plastic. She opens it. It is her copy of PERSUASION. ONE PAGE is marked by a ROSE, now dried and withered by time. She opens to the page. A sentence is underlined. "There could have been no two hearts so open, no tastes so similar, no feelings so in unison." She stares at it, her breath catching in her throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An overcast winter day. Lucy waits in the cold outside a converted loft building. Morgan arrives and they go in together. As they do, they pass a SIGN with a logo that consists of TWO INTERTWINED V'S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy and Morgan wait in a loft space. The offices look sort of makeshift. Morgan looks around.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: It's a new firm.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: I'm sure they're very good.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: While we're waiting. She hands him a card.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Happy Valentine's.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Lu. Thanks. Oh God, I didn't get you anything -- I've been so swamped...

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter. A RECEPTIONIST approaches them. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Doctor Forster? They're ready for you. They follow her back to a conference area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry and Julian coming out in their winter coats. Henry's dressed for another job interview, Julian going to school. As they emerge out onto the street they realize it is surprisingly warm.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (shrugs) Global warming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy and Morgan wait in the conference area. The door opens and an architect comes in. HENRY -- now two years older, professional.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Hi. Henry Ferris. Sorry to keep you waiting. I'm sort of the number two man here. The boss'1ll be here any second. Lucy and Morgan nod. Then after a moment the door opens again. They look up. VANESSA enters -- now sleekly dressed, confident, assertive.

dialogues.speaker: VANESSA
dialogues.text: Dr. Forster? Hi, we spoke on the phone. Vanessa Vanderbeck. Welcome to Vanderbeck and Associates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They examine sketches for the remodeling. Morgan looks unhappy.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: so that's basically what we're picturing.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: It's kind of... out there, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: VANESSA
dialogues.text: This is the direction Lucy said she was looking for.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: I love it. I think it's great. Morgan glares at her. She shoots a look back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian and Henry open their coats as they walk in the warm weather.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: You want to grab a beer after your interview later?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Can't. Taking Vanessa out for Valentine's. Julian keeps going for a few more steps. Then he stops.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: What? She's my girlfriend. Is that strange? Julian looks around. The warm day. PEOPLE on the street enjoying the sunshine. Julian turns back to Henry, a strange look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: What is the date? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Valentine's Day. It’s February 14, what do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: February 14. 2004.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Yes. What is the matter with you?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: (slowly) She told me about today.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Who? You mean the girl?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Yes! There's a letter that says where she's gonna be.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: She wrote to you?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. I could see her today. You said it last night -- what have I got to lose?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: What are you waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: I've just got to find the letter! Julian runs back to the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their meeting concluding, Lucy and Morgan shake hands with Vanessa and Henry.

dialogues.speaker: VANESSA
dialogues.text: Well, terrific. We'll draw up some preliminary blueprints and go from there.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Great. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: VANESSA
dialogues.text: Henry, can you make sure they have everything they need from us?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Yes, of course.

dialogues.speaker: VANESSA
dialogues.text: Good. We'll be in touch. She exits. Henry walks Lucy and Morgan out.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: So, how long have you lived in Chicago?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Well, I've been here about two years... As they walk, they pass a series of framed PICTURES on the wall. We see several of Henry's old Escher prints... and then, finally, something else. It is JULIAN'S LAKE HOUSE DRAWING. Lucy doesn't notice it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian rummages madly through his things. He can't find Lucy's letters anywhere. Then he remembers where they are. He runs from the room. The LAKE HOUSE DRAWING flutters to the floor in his wake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy and Morgan pull their coats on, preparing to leave. Lucy suddenly freezes. She is staring across the loft. She has noticed the Lake House Drawing. She slowly crosses the room until she's standing in front of it. She stays there, absolutely riveted, not speaking.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Lu? Henry is nearby talking to a co-worker. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: (softly) What is this? Henry looks over. He clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: This? Uh, this was done by a friend of mine.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Julian Burnham.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Julian...

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: Yes. (off her look) Did you... did you know him?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Yes. He -- Where is he? Do you know how I could get in touch with him? Henry looks stricken. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. You don't know?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: He died. Two years ago.

dialogues.speaker: ON LUCY
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY
dialogues.text: (realizing) Two years ago today, actually, There was an accident... Lucy tries to take this in. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: (whispers) Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has begun to rain. Lucy runs out _of the firm and to her car. Morgan is behind her, bewildered, trying to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Lucy! Wait! What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: It's an emergency.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Are you going to the hospital? She looks at him. She touches his face, gently.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: No... I'm sorry. She kisses him, quickly, upset, then jumps to her car and races away. Morgan watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian driving North out of the city. Bright sun. He's eager, excited. He accelerates, passing traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy driving North out of the city, frantic, RAIN POUNDING onto her WINDSHIELD. She weaves in and out of lanes, passing cars, driving recklessly, as fast as she can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian pulls up outside the Lake House. It's shut, empty. He runs across the jetty and unlocks the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy arrives at the House and SKIDS to a stop in the rain in front of the mailbox. She pulls out a pad and begins writing, desperately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian runs up to the attic. Inside is the single box he stored there when he moved out. He tears the box open and rummages through it. He locates the bundle of Lucy's letters. He shuffles through them and finds the one he's looking for. He reads it.

dialogues.speaker: THE LETTER
dialogues.text: Lucy's writing: "LAST FEBRUARY -- I REMEMBER IT WAS

dialogues.speaker: VALENTINE'S DAY, BUT IT WAS REALLY WARM
dialogues.text: LUNCH AT BUCKINGHAM FOUNTAIN...”

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Buckingham Fountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy finishes the note and jumps out of the car. She shoves it into the mailbox and raises the flag. She stands there, clutching the box, the rain soaking her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian jumps into his truck. He pulls away quickly from the Lake House. He passes the mailbox. The flag is up. We can SEE the raised flag in his REARVIEW MIRROR... And we ---

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIND Lucy finishing her lunch in the Lakefront park, not far from Buckingham Fountain, on this unusually warm day -- February 14, 2004. She squints into the sunlight gleaming off the Lake. A pair of OLD MEN on the next bench over.

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: What’s with the damn weather? 60 degrees on Valentine’s Day!

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: It's global warming. The FOUNTAIN sends up a huge plume of water. She begins walking toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian can see the fountain from inside his truck. He drives down Lake Shore Drive, looking for a parking space. He eventually finds one and jumps out. He begins jogging toward the park. And we HEAR --

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Dear Julian. I know now -- it was you at the Fountain that day. It was you in the park. Please don't go. Something terrible happens if you do. Julian continues jogging toward the Fountain. He stops. There are two lanes of heavy traffic in front of him. He searches in the distance, looking for Lucy beyond the WHIZZING TRAFFIC, among the crowds in the park.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Please don't look for me. He finally spots her -- a distant figure, walking on the other side of the fountain. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Don't try to find me. We see the two of them, no longer separated by time, only by distance. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Don't run to me. A break in the traffic. Julian has a clear view of Lucy straight ahead of him.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Do you understand? Please. You have to wait. Julian steps off the curb. A BUS turning off Lake Shore Drive is heading right for him.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Forget everything I said before. We both have to wait. The DRIVER sees Julian and crushes his foot onto the brake.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: If you love me -- and I love you, I do, it has taken me all this time to say it but I do love you - - wait for me.

dialogues.speaker: ON LUCY
dialogues.text: Alarmed, turning as she hears the SQUEAL of the bus' BRAKES.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Wait with me. Wait until time catches up with both of us and we can be together. Please. Just... Wait.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: The bus is bearing down fast on Julian, who is staring straight ahead at Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Wait...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Lucy 1s soaked, dissolved in tears at the base of the mailbox.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: Wait. Wait... She weeps. A long, bitter moment. The RAIN continues to POUND DOWN. Finally she stops, having given up hope, and tries to collect herself. She starts, very slowly, to get to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MAILBOX
dialogues.text: Its flag is down.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Lucy is stunned. She very slowly reaches up and pulls open the mailbox door. She almost can't bear to look inside. Her letter is gone. CUT TO;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian is standing in the road, straining to see Lucy. The bus is right on top of him. At the last second he steps back onto the curb, safe.

dialogues.speaker: ON LUCY
dialogues.text: As she watches the bus proceed without incident down the road. Except for the fact that the squealing sound has stopped, it has no significance for her, and she turns back to continue her walk.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO JULIAN
dialogues.text: As the bus passes harmlessly in front of him. MOVE DOWN. His hand is at his side, clutching Lucy's letter. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at her writing. The words "WAIT, WAIT." He looks into the distance as...

dialogues.speaker: ACROSS THE PARK
dialogues.text: Lucy checks her watch. Her lunch break is over. She pauses for one last glance at the shimmering Lake, the sun soaked park, then turns and heads quickly back toward downtown. Julian wants, desperately, to step off the curb again and run to her. But he doesn't. He folds the letter. He puts it in his pocket and slowly, with great difficulty, turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy staring into the empty mailbox, her face soaked by tears and rain. A HAND reaches from behind her and gently closes the box. She slowly turns. Julian is two years older but mostly unchanged. He stands quietly, looking at her, holding the now-worn letter she just posted. They just look at each other for a moment. Then he takes a step towards her. He smiles, shyly.

dialogues.speaker: JULIAN
dialogues.text: Have we waited long enough? She just stares at him for a moment, trying to convince herself this is real.

dialogues.speaker: LUCY
dialogues.text: (whispers) Yes. Then they fall into each other’s arms. When the kiss finally ends, he takes her hand. They turn. Lucy gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It has been transformed. In the two years that has passed in Julian's life -- the life she saved -- he has transformed it. It's now his drawing come to life -- the warmer, romantic house with the deck, and the stairs to the water that they talked about, and the trees planted along the jetty, lit and glowing in the rain. She laughs, astonished. He smiles. They take hands and kiss again. Then they walk slowly across the jetty and toward the house together. FADE OUT.
